comment: For essays, the guidelines were never clear but the grading was always harsh. He waited until we had 3 weeks left in the course to start accusing people of AI use; replacing their previous scores with 0's. Every assignment we had was due at 11:59 and he made 1 singular assignment due at 5:05 with no notice, it almost felt purposeful.
Assignments aren't hard class and the class is easy I enjoy philosophy. However his AI policy is so ridiculous claiming grammarly as AI and flagging it

(from a diff philo course) 

Pineiro is great!

One critique I have (and this is more possibly to do with the state of undergrad education) is that I wanted more lectures and less group/ discussion pedagogy. Discussion is great, but when everyone does the reading and/ or is engaged. It felt a little sad at times when he changed plans due to this.
This class completely changed how I think about philosophy Be ready to actually do the work though No coasting
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Dr. Pineiro's Intro to Phil was one of the most thought-provoking classes I've taken—he really pushed us to think critically, especially about race and justice, and the readings were powerful. The ungrading system was tough at first, but it made me care more about actually learning than just chasing a grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Most difficult intro class. Never responds to emails. The grading policy is terrible and you don't know your letter grade until grades are posted. Lookup "Ungrading policy", that's how he grades. Essay guidelines are not specific and easy to misunderstand, then says everyone uses AI. Lectures are long and not interesting. Won't be taking him again.

worst teacher ive ever had. changed assigment dates and amounts and didnt tell us. accuses everyone of ai use, 85% of the class got 0s and we had no say in it. never responds to emails. sent one in the first month of school and still havent gotten one back. makes an intro class almost impossible. required extra credit essays to get an a or b.
This was my favorite class this semester!

All of his quizzes were online and they were easy as long as you listened and took notes on what he would say in the lectures. Two essays and there were extra credit opportunities that I recommend you should take. Make sure to be on top of the quiz dates and discussions because he does not notify about it.

Overall, this is a great professor. If you do the work and complete any bonus work, you will be fine. I also encourage participation, the more you interact with the lectures the more you get out of the class. My biggest piece of advice is to pay attention to any instructions for essays. Also, he is a huge nerd so it made classes a bit more fun.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This professor was overall an okay professor to take for his online class consisting of weekly quizzes and discussion post which were due over the weekend. Yet, at the end of the semester, his grading for papers was brutal leaving my overall grade to be lower than it should've been. His instructions were confusing at times as well. No extra credit.
He was great!! Took him last semester, I had hesitations about the class but ti was good. He offered many extra credit opportunities and although I never did any, I got an A. Take him, very chill!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: He gives so many extra credit opportunities in case you miss a discussion post or quiz, which is extremely convenient. All of the quizzes are online. We only had 2 essays to write for the entire semester but they aren't that hard in my opinion. He's really chill and considerate about grading
Not focused on educating, talks at you, not to you

Amazing professor! He listened to the feedback we gave him and changed assignments/ due dates based on that. Great lectures and he takes time to explain any concept the class might not quite understand. Would definitely take another class from him and would highly recommend him!

His lectures are really enjoyable and fun. I'm not a fan of his grading criteria as it is not traditional. 2 extra credit assignments, 11/12 on both papers, etc. are required for an A. If you don't meet all the criteria for an A you will get a B even if you only fell short on one thing. It's not too difficult but requires some extra effort.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy

comment: great professor with amazing lectures. he is always available and he made learning about philosophy fun and enjoyable.

The class was reading-heavy, but he is really laid back and an easy grader. I learned a ton; his discussions were super engaging. Although the term papers are an important part of your grade, he allows students to resubmit if they did not get a good grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: Emails timely, open for office hours,  many readings but goes over them and breaks down important things in class, gives MANY extra credit opportunities, 2-4 attempts on weekly quizzes, there's also weekly simple discussions. (He will drop a few) he loves class interaction. Overall funny and laid back professor. 2 term papers, short essay as final.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Goated
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring
